verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
verses.web: “On the first day of the first month you shall raise up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: "On the 1st day of the 1st month, you are to set up the tabernacle — the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the vail.
verses.web: You shall put the ark of the covenant in it, and you shall screen the ark with the veil.
verses.ct: Place the ark of the covenant inside it, and hang the veil to screen the ark from view.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light the lamps thereof.
verses.web: You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the lamp stand, and light its lamps.
verses.ct: Bring in the table and arrange everything on it properly. Then bring in the lampstand and light its lamps.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
verses.web: You shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the covenant, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verses.ct: Set the golden altar for incense in front of the ark of the covenant, and hang the curtain across the entrance to the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
verses.web: “You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water therein.
verses.web: You shall set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and shall put water therein.
verses.ct: Set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and fill it with water.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court gate.
verses.web: You shall set up the court around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.
verses.ct: Set up the courtyard walls around the whole area, and hang the curtain at the courtyard gate.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels thereof: and it shall be holy.
verses.web: “You shall take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it, and shall make it holy, and all its furniture, and it will be holy.
verses.ct: Then take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and everything in it. Set it apart as holy — every piece of furniture — and it will be holy.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all his vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.
verses.web: You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering, with all its vessels, and sanctify the altar, and the altar will be most holy.
verses.ct: Anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils. Set the altar apart as holy, and it will become most holy.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt anoint the laver and his foot, and sanctify it.
verses.web: You shall anoint the basin and its base, and sanctify it.
verses.ct: Anoint the basin and its stand, and set them apart as holy.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.
verses.web: “You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall wash them with water.
verses.ct: Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and wash them with water.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.web: You shall put on Aaron the holy garments; and you shall anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: Dress Aaron in the holy garments, anoint him, and set him apart as holy so he can serve me as priest.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:
verses.web: You shall bring his sons, and put tunics on them.
verses.ct: Bring his sons forward and dress them in their tunics.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
verses.web: You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest’s office. Their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.”
verses.ct: Anoint them just as you anointed their father, so they too can serve me as priests. This anointing will establish an everlasting priesthood for their descendants throughout every generation."

verses.kjv: Thus did Moses: according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
verses.web: Moses did so. According to all that LORD commanded him, so he did.
verses.ct: Moses did everything exactly as the LORD commanded him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
verses.web: In the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was raised up.
verses.ct: On the 1st day of the 1st month of the 2nd year, the tabernacle was set up.

verses.kjv: And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened his sockets, and set up the boards thereof, and put in the bars thereof, and reared up his pillars.
verses.web: Moses raised up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and raised up its pillars.
verses.ct: Moses raised the tabernacle by laying its bases, setting up its frames, inserting its crossbars, and raising its pillars.

verses.kjv: And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: He spread the covering over the tent, and put the roof of the tabernacle above on it, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He spread the tent covering over the tabernacle and placed the outer roof on top of it, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staves on the ark, and put the mercy seat above upon the ark:
verses.web: He took and put the covenant into the ark, and set the poles on the ark, and put the mercy seat above on the ark.
verses.ct: He took the tablets of the covenant and placed them inside the ark, attached the carrying poles to the ark, and set the mercy seat on top of it.

verses.kjv: And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the vail of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: He brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the covenant, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Then he brought the ark into the tabernacle and hung the screening veil to shield the ark of the covenant, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the vail.
verses.web: He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside of the veil.
verses.ct: He placed the table in the Tent of Meeting on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil.

verses.kjv: And he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD; as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.web: He set the bread in order on it before LORD, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He arranged the bread on it in the LORD's presence, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
verses.web: He put the lamp stand in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the south side of the tabernacle.
verses.ct: He placed the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting across from the table, on the south side of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And he lighted the lamps before the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: He lit the lamps before LORD, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He lit the lamps before the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation before the vail:
verses.web: He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting before the veil;
verses.ct: He placed the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting in front of the veil.

verses.kjv: And he burnt sweet incense thereon; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: and he burned incense of sweet spices on it, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He burned fragrant incense on it, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
verses.web: He put up the screen of the door to the tabernacle.
verses.ct: He hung the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And he put the altar of burnt offering by the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt offering and the meat offering; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: He set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the meal offering, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: He set the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and offered burnt offerings and grain offerings on it, just as the LORD had commanded him.

verses.kjv: And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash withal.
verses.web: He set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash.
verses.ct: He placed the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and filled it with water for washing.

verses.kjv: And Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet thereat:
verses.web: Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and their feet there.
verses.ct: Moses, Aaron, and Aaron's sons washed their hands and feet there.

verses.kjv: When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: When they went into the Tent of Meeting, and when they came near to the altar, they washed, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: Whenever they entered the Tent of Meeting or approached the altar, they washed — just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court gate. So Moses finished the work.
verses.web: He raised up the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
verses.ct: He set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar, and hung the curtain at the courtyard gate. And with that, Moses finished the work.

verses.kjv: Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
verses.web: Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and LORD’s glory filled the tabernacle.
verses.ct: Then a cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode thereon, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
verses.web: Moses wasn’t able to enter into the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and LORD’s glory filled the tabernacle.
verses.ct: Moses couldn't even enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud had settled over it and the glory of the LORD filled every part of the tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward in all their journeys:
verses.web: When the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys;
verses.ct: Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle, the Israelites would break camp and move on.

verses.kjv: But if the cloud were not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
verses.web: but if the cloud wasn’t taken up, then they didn’t travel until the day that it was taken up.
verses.ct: But if the cloud didn't lift, they stayed put until the day it did.

verses.kjv: For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
verses.web: For the cloud of LORD was on the tabernacle by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
verses.ct: The cloud of the LORD rested over the tabernacle during the day, and fire glowed within it at night — visible to every Israelite household throughout all their travels.
